title: Senior Director, Head of Operate & Automate IT
description:
**Job Advertisement: Senior Director, Head of Operate & Automate IT**
 We are currently seeking a dynamic and experienced Senior Director to join our team as the Head of Operate & Automate IT, reporting directly to our Group CIO. In this role, you will be responsible for leading the team managing the portfolio of IT solutions that drive our network operations (Fulfillment, Inventory, Assurance) across the company. You will play a pivotal role in overseeing the development, implementation, and lifecycle of technology solutions that enhance our business processes and IT operations. Your leadership will be instrumental in driving innovation, ensuring seamless IT operations, and aligning technology initiatives with business objectives.
   

  

**Why should you join us?**
 GlobalConnect is one of the leading providers of digital infrastructure solutions in the Nordics, with a strong focus on innovation and customer satisfaction. As a member of our team, you will have the opportunity to work with some of the brightest minds in the industry and be part of a company that is at the forefront of digital transformation. Additionally, we offer a competitive salary and benefits package, as well as a dynamic and inclusive work environment that values diversity and collaboration. If you are looking for a challenging and rewarding career in the IT industry, we encourage you to join us.
   

  

**Why now?**
 Now is an exciting time to join our team as we embark on the consolidation of our landscape with new OSS and Monitoring solutions. These strategic initiatives will not only streamline our operations but also enhance our ability to deliver superior service and innovation. Your expertise will be crucial in driving this transformation and ensuring its successful implementation. Additionally, we are seeking a permanent manager to take over and provide stable, long-term leadership after having had an interim manager in place, ensuring continuity and sustained progress in our IT operations and automation efforts.
   

  

**Responsibilities:**
* Develop and execute the technology strategy for Operate & Automate IT solutions in alignment with the company's overall vision and goals.
* Lead and manage a cross-country team in the Nordics consisting of IT professionals, including solution architects, developers, analysts, and project managers.
* Oversee the end-to-end lifecycle of Operate & Automate IT solutions, from concept ideation to deployment and ongoing optimization.
* Collaborate cross-functionally with architects, infrastructure, other IT solution areas, and various stakeholders to understand business requirements and align technology solutions accordingly.
* Develop and manage budgets, resource allocation, and cost-effective strategies for Operate & Automate IT projects.
* Ensure operational excellence through continuous improvement of IT processes, automation, and service delivery.
* Foster a culture of innovation and continuous learning within the team.


**Requirements:**
* Proven experience (10+ years) in a leadership role within IT and/or Telecom, specifically focusing on operational and automation solutions.
* In-depth understanding of IT and network operations, automation technologies, platforms, and architectures, with a track record of successful solution delivery.
* Strong leadership skills with the ability to inspire and motivate teams, fostering a collaborative and high-performance work environment.
* Excellent communication and stakeholder management abilities, enabling effective interaction with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field (relevant certifications and additional qualifications are a plus).
* You are based in Stockholm, Oslo, or Copenhagen.


 If you are a strategic thinker with a problem-solving mindset and a passion for driving technological innovation in IT operations and automation, we would love to hear from you. Join us in shaping the future of our IT solutions and making a meaningful impact on our business and our customers. You will report to our Group CIO.

title: IT Service Manager, Applications, Solna
description:
*Do you want to be part of a dynamic and rapidly changing environment at Postnord IT Workplace department. If you have experience of Managerial role/s and background around Application Service Management or very similar this is the job for you!*
*We are seeking a person with relevant experience that is interested in processes and standardization and enjoy driving continuous improvements?*
 Join us
   

  

 The Workplace department today has around 15 team members who are responsible for Postnord’s IT Workplace for both administration and production workforce.
   

  

 The Workplace technologies are constantly evolving and we always aim for secure, reliable and user friendly services. In our work we continuously keep an eye on Postnord’s overall vision and strategies to ensure our services enable and support the company’s market positioning.
   

  

**Job Duties**
 In the role as IT Service Manager for Applications, you will be working with both strategic, tactical and operational duties around Application Management.
   

  

 The role is on senior level and among other things working with:
   

  

* Manage IT's application portfolio and it's lifecycle.
* Work with application owner community to ensure updates are made in the portfolio and when relevant explain or refresh the application management roles and responsibilities.
* Support stakeholders that need help or guidance around application management and application packaging services.
* Manage the lifecycle of Workplace common core applications including collaboration with stakeholders and communication, as well as ensuring that the expectations and feedback of the users, customers, and sponsors are met and addressed.
* Work closely with the Service Manager for User Experience and ensure the IT knowledge and end-user instructions are up to date and available.
* Budget, follow-up and forecasting according to internal standards and expectations.
* Collaborate and support the other Service and Platform Managers within the Workplace unit.
* Collaboration outside Workplace, both with internal and external work areas around Software Asset Management.
* Stay up to date on IT market trends and innovation.


 We are looking for you who have
   

  

* At least three years of experience in managing software applications and services, preferably in a large and complex environment.
* Experience and knowledge of the application domain, technologies such as application packaging and automatization for installation, methodologies, and best practices.
* General Subject Matter expert of the Application Management area.
* Basic understanding of ITIL framework
* Fluent English, both spoken and written
* Fluent Swedish or Danish, both spoken and written


 We believe you are a person that is thorough, analytical and easy to get acquainted with and learn new systems. Your way of working is inclusive, structured and responsible.
   

  

 You need to be able to handle stressful situations and prioritize job tasks independently. You are communicative and easy to collaborate with, and are diplomatic in your way of creating and nurturing long-term relationships.
   

  

 Additionally, you have previous experience of systems like Service Management Tooling, MS 365 Office applications, Power BI and other tools required for Business Planning (budget, follow-up, forecast), SNOW and Intune.
   

  

 It is an advantage if you have previous experience from working in an IT senior managerial role and is used to coach and guide others around the solution area where you are the expert.
   

  

**We Offer You**
 We offer a role that is part of our dynamic team including Service Managers, Engineers respectively a Chief Architect. The roles in Workplace are dedicated to certain solutions areas and are responsible for governing outsourced Workplace services and/or some of the internally managed services. The daily work varies in an international environment with constantly new challenges and quick decisions. Here you have opportunities to develop creative solutions and work in a prestige-free group where we jointly help to reach our goals. PostNord is one of Sweden's largest workplaces and we offer safe employment conditions and benefits. In addition to the benefits mentioned above, we offer:
   

  

* Hybrid workplace with a Nordic and dynamic environment. Watch the video about our office.
* Great development opportunities
* Great insurance and occupational pension terms
* Wellness allowance & opportunity to train at Arken's gym and indoor swimming pool
* Employee benefits through PostNord Plus - PostNord´s own personnel foundation


 We make everyday life easier
   

  

 PostNord is the leading supplier of communication and logistics solutions to, from, and within the Nordic region. We ensure the provision of a postal service to households and businesses in Sweden and Denmark. We aim to make everyday life easier and more sustainable for everyone who lives and works in the Nordic region. We are in a constant transformation and work consistently to develop both our offer and our employees, all to achieve our vision of being The favorite carrier of the Nordics. We are PostNord - a fantastic company to work and grow with. Read more at postnord.com
   

  

 Apply
   

  

 We look forward to receive your application!
   

  

 If you have any questions or concerns, please contact Susanne Wetterstrand on phone number: +46 72-585 32 85.
   

  

 Don't wait to submit your application as we go through the applications on an ongoing basis.
   

  

 For union representatives, visit: www.postnord.com/fackliga

title: Cloud Architect
description:
Accenture’s clients want to work with us because we are a global professional services company with more than 750 000 people who are among the best in the world at what we do. We are all one Accenture and share experience and knowledge with each other to provide our clients with nothing but the best of bread solutions and beyond.
   

  

**Life at Accenture**
 Throughout your time at Accenture, we do not only offer our people the training they need but also expect them to take the time to learn and grow in a culture of continuous improvement. As you progress through your career, in the path you choose, you will move towards a leadership role in the truest sense of the word. Leaders lead by respect, knowledge and by helping those more junior than themselves.
   

  

**How will you spend your days as a Cloud First Design Architect?**
- By using your knowledge and skills to challenge your teammates and your leaders to innovate on extensive existing knowledge and expertise to provide balanced and inventive solutions, exceeding industry standards.

- Facilitating client workshops where we share our knowledge, plan and/or design solutions for our clients.

- Designing, provisioning and/or securing cloud architectures for global and local business critical systems.

- Engagement in architecture or other training as a student or faculty.

- You may also be mid project where you are bringing your skills to our clients by orchestrating and automating environments for a proof-of-concept demo or even getting ready for a production deployment.

- In all of this you can rest assured that Accenture have high ethical standards which make you proud to work for an organisation like this which also cares primarily for our people!

**Career progression**
 At Accenture there are clearly defined career paths to help our people progress and grow their career paths. At Accenture, your career is your own and you have the freedom and the responsibility to steer it towards your own personal aspirations.
   

  

**Benefits**
- Cloudy University: our continuous learning platform that will provide training and career development opportunities.

- Partnership with Cloud Guru.

- Ability to craft your career based on your own aspirations having support from your own career counsellor, and probably become one over time.

- Great benefits for parental leave and health package. Competitive salary terms, bonus schemes, health insurance, employee stock purchase program and other benefits.

- Work-life balance: good arrangements to combine family life with work and active support for mental health.

- Opportunities to get involved in corporate citizenship initiatives, from volunteering to doing charity work, as well Inclusion & Diversity networks.

- Employee wellbeing is highly valued topic for us, so we offer all our new joiners with 4 weeks of paid holiday for the first summer working with us.

**How to stand out?**
- Tell us how you are passionate about technology.

- Be able to articulate your knowledge to not only other technical people, but also to non-technical business focused people and help them understand what the technology would mean to them and why they should care.

- Have 5+ years’ experience working with one or more cloud providers’ technologies such as AWS (Amazon Web Services), Azure, Google Cloud, and others.

- Those 5+ years should at least in part be focused on working with infrastructure transformation and/or cloud transformation.

- Have a good understanding of the full technology lifecycle, including Design, Build, Deploy, Migrate, Operate, Sunset and Tombstoning, and how it impacts dependant solutions and business functional requirements.

**Location**
 Stockholm
   

  

**Minimum Requirements**
- At least a bachelor’s level degree or similar in a technical focused area such as engineering or computer science.

- Fluent in English

**Equal Employment Opportunity Statement**
 All employment decisions shall be made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other basis as protected by federal, state, or local law.
   

  

 Job candidates will not be obligated to disclose sealed or expunged records of conviction or arrest as part of the hiring process.
   

  

 Accenture is committed to providing veteran employment opportunities to our service men and women.

title: CRM Specialist
description:
Despite healthcare spending at an all-time high, patient waiting time is getting longer, and patients aren’t accessing the quality of care they deserve. At Kry, we believe we can play a unique role in changing this.
   

  

 As Europe’s leading digital healthcare provider and one of the largest healthcare providers in Sweden, we believe that providing accessible and affordable healthcare has never been more important. Our vision has been consistent and clear: great healthcare for everyone. Do you share our vision and want to be part of shaping the future of healthcare?
   

  

 The Role
   

  

 We’re looking for a
 **CRM Specialist** 
 who is agile, curious, solution oriented and committed to detail and accuracy to join our CRM team. In this role, you will play a pivotal role in developing and executing CRM activities across our France and UK markets. This is a very exciting opportunity as you’re joining at a pivotal time - this role will give you the opportunity to grow your skills while getting empowered within a data-driven and creative work environment.
   

  

 What You Will Do
   

  

**Core Responsibilities**
* Play a key role in the development and execution of the CRM strategy
* Coordinate and work closely with the copywriters in each market
* Plan, build and deliver multi-channel communications (emails, push notifications and in-app messages) using our CRM tool Braze
* Fully own our weekly newsletter, including planning and coordinating content with the copywriter and SEO team, building and launching it, monitoring performance and driving improvements
* Actively drive and support the planning and delivery of our ongoing test-and-learn strategy
* Be involved in and coordinate a variety of projects with different business areas
* Manage reports and monitor campaign performance
* Work with Braze and our Martech team to grow our data points within Braze, allowing us to fully leverage the tool and drive initiatives across various user touchpoints
* Assist in quality assurance for our CRM campaigns


 Who You Are
   

  

 If you're passionate about driving customer engagement and leveraging CRM technology, this opportunity is tailored for you. The ideal candidate will bring an enthusiastic "can-do" spirit to the team, pay close attention to details, communicate effectively, and thrive as a collaborative team player.
   

  

**We Are Looking For Someone With**
* 2-3 years of relevant experience working in CRM, building campaigns and automations (Braze is an advantage)
* A good understanding of email and push marketing, CRM metrics, performance management and testing
* Can do attitude with a high attention to detail
* Organised, able to multitask, meet deadlines and adapt to changing environments
* A passion for making marketing communications as relevant to patients as possible, communicating clearly and effectively with consistency
* Team player with strong communication skills
* Experience working in direct campaign set-up and management in a CRM tool
* Keen to challenge current ways of working to improve performance and increase efficiencies
* Fluent in English - Swedish and/or French is an advantage
* The position is full time, based in our Stockholm office.


**Join us and shape your future as well as ours!**
 If you think you’re up to the challenge, come and help us to grow, innovate and develop! A diverse workforce is an absolute necessity for anyone with a vision like ours: to provide great healthcare for everyone. Therefore we celebrate differences and are committed to creating an inclusive environment where all employees can truly belong and thrive. We offer a hybrid way of working where we aim to be at our great office at least 3 days a week to cater for a great relationship with our colleagues.
   

  

**About Kry/Livi**
 Kry/Livi is the European leader in digital healthcare, allowing patients to see a doctor, nurse, or psychologist online within minutes. We also combine digital with physical care, transforming how millions of patients access healthcare. Headquartered in Stockholm, we are committed to improving the world’s health through innovation, one patient at a time. In Sweden and Norway we are called Kry. In the UK and France, we operate under the name Livi.
   

  

**Submissions and Questions**
 Please submit your application by including your CV, LinkedIn, GitHub, or Portfolio (where applicable). No submission will be accepted via email, nor when the job posting has become inactive. All applications must go via the careers site or an official Kry / Livi job post.

title: Cloud Architect
description:
*Founded in 2018, Kreditz is already the market leader in PSD2 credit scoring products.*
*We use Open Banking/PSD2 technology to create our revolutionizing real-time credit scoring products, which are beloved by banks, financial institutions, gambling companies and many more. Kreditz products enable consumers, and businesses, to gain financial inclusion, and financial opportunity where none would be available with traditional credit scoring systems.*
*Our long-term vision "One world, One score" translates into our everyday mission of financial inclusion, and financial opportunity, for everyone around the globe
   

  

 – Everyone deserves a fair assessment.*
*To fuel our growth to the next level, we recently added 10m EUR of funding from world renown investors Creades and Ingka Investments.*
*Come join us on our impactful mission!*
**About The Position**
 Thanks to a continuous three figure growth (+170% FY22 vs FY21) and ambitious expansion plans we are looking to strengthen our organization further with a
 *Cloud Architect* 
 . We are currently entering an exciting phase (startup to scaleup) and expanding our market presence rapidly in the Nordic countries and in Europe. Our clients range from some of Europe’s largest banks and iGaming companies to smaller, innovative businesses.
   

  

**What Can Kreditz Offer**
* One-way ticket to an amazing growth journey you will never forget – A journey where everyone in the team plays a crucial role for our company’s success
* Fun-loving, passionate, and talented colleagues with whom to share small and big company, and personal, milestones and accomplishments
* Humble corporate culture – we celebrate all wins, no matter the size, together!
* 24/7 access to gym/sauna/sports center at our office PLUS additional wellness allowance
* Fixed salary


**Responsibilities**
 Key responsibilities as Cloud Architect at Kreditz:
   

  

* Design and implement scalable and secure cloud architectures that align with business objectives and requirements.
* Evaluate existing cloud infrastructure and make recommendations for improvement and optimization.
* Develop cloud migration strategies and execute the migration of on-premises systems to the cloud.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define cloud-related requirements and provide technical guidance.
* Ensure the security and compliance of cloud environments, implementing necessary controls and monitoring systems.
* Stay up to date with emerging cloud technologies, trends, and best practices.
* Provide guidance and support to development teams in implementing cloud-native solutions.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to define and prioritize cloud initiatives based on business needs.
* Conduct cost analysis and optimization of cloud resources to maximize efficiency and minimize expenses.


**WE ARE LOOKING FOR**
 We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Cloud Architect to join our IT team at Kreditz. As a Cloud Architect, you will play a critical role in optimizing our cloud services, reducing costs, and improving the performance of our expanding algorithms/logic. You will be responsible for designing and implementing cloud-based solutions, ensuring efficient cloud usage, and staying up to date with industry best practices.
   

  

**Additionally We Believe You Have**
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
* 3-5 years of experience in Cloud Architect or similar role.
* Proven experience as a Cloud Architect or in a similar role.
* Strong expertise in cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud.
* In-depth knowledge of cloud architecture patterns, best practices, and security frameworks.
* Experience with containerization technologies such as Micro-services, Docker and orchestration tools like Kubernetes.
* Familiarity with DevOps practices and tools.
* Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
* Excellent communication skills in Swedish and English (verbal and written).
* Knowledge of additional European languages can be meritorious.
* Relevant certifications such as AWS Certified Solutions Architect or Azure Solutions Architect are a plus.
* Experience working with FinTech and PSD2 technologies are a plus.


**APPOINTMENT OF ROLE**
 Starting date Q3Q4 2023
   

  

**SCOPE**
 Fulltime, permanent employment (tillsvidareanställning)
   

  

**SALARY**
 Fixed monthly salary
   

  

**REPORTING**
 You will be reporting to the company’s CTO
   

  

**WORKPLACE**
 Our office is in Danderyd, Stockholm
   

  

**RECRUITMENT PROCESS**
 We interview candidates on an ongoing basis (ongoing selection)
   

  

**CONTACT**
 Lorenzo Puccio, COO, Lorenzo@kreditz.com
   

  

 For more information about the role feel free to reach out to our CTO arlen@kreditz.com

title: IT-arkitekt med fokus på övergripande arkitektur
description:
*Har du flerårig relevant yrkeserfarenhet inom arkitekturområdet i ledande befattning samtidigt som du har ett starkt eget driv med vana att utmana existerande modeller?* 
*Vi söker just nu en IT-arkitekt där huvuduppgiften syftar till att vara med och leda arbetet med att använda arkitektur för att vi ska uppnå våra mål att erbjuda digitala tjänster i världsklass till våra kunder och medarbetare.*
*För oss på Länsförsäkringar står digitalisering och hållbarhet högst upp på agendan och med vår omfattande affärsverksamhet, samt dess utbud av produkter och tjänster, så har vi en mängd spännande utmaningar för att säkerställa helhetsperspektivet. Låter det intressant? Läs vidare!*
**Om jobbet**
 I rollen som IT-arkitekt kommer du vara en viktig del av Arktiekt-teamet inom Länsförsäkringar Sak vars huvudsakliga syfte är att bidra till strategiska förflyttningar och säkerhetsställa att IT utvecklas i enlighet med våra strategier och affärsmål. Du kommer att ingå i ett team av arkitekter som arbetar nära våra ledare inom verksamhet och IT. Du kommer att vara organiserad i affärsverksamheten Sak och utifrån det jobba verksamhetsövergripande inom Sakförsäkring och med våra Systemarkitekter i våra lean-agila tåg.
   

  

 Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter i denna roll är följande:
   

  

* Omsätta Länsförsäkringar Saks strategier och strategiska mål till målbilder och målarkitekturer för IT-landskapet med utgångspunkt från ett verksamhets- och informationsperspektiv.
* Bistå beslutsfattare med strategisk rådgivning.
* Delta och utveckla Länsförsäkringar Saks arkitekturfunktion som består av bland annat Chefs-, informations-, Enterprise-, och IT-arkitekter inom hela Länsförsäkringar AB-koncernen.
* Omvärldsbevaka och följa utvecklingen inom arkitektur för att säkerställa att Länsförsäkringar tar väl underbyggda strategiska inriktningsbeslut.
* Agera som arkitekt i uppdrag och projektets tidiga faser.
* Delta i upphandling av nya system och starta upp arkitekturstyrning inom nya områden.
* Samarbeta nära med affärsutvecklare, EA-arkitekter, tågen och andra affärsenheters arkitekter.


**Vem är du?**
 För att bli framåtstående i denna roll önskar vi att du har följande kvalifikationer:
   

  

* Du är en person som har ett starkt eget driv, du har en flerårig relevant yrkeserfarenhet inom arkitekturområdet i ledande befattning och erfarenhet av att utreda, sätta övergripande lösningar och nyttja arkitektur som ett förändringsinstrument.
* Minst 6–8 års erfarenhet av arkitekturarbete inom större företag, med tidigare roller som Enterprise-, affärs/domän-, chefsarkitekt eller motsvarande.
* Relevant akademisk examen (ex. ingenjörsutbildning, civilekonom, systemvetare).
* God förståelse för affär och teknik, med erfarenhet av att ta fram applikations-, integrations- och säkerhetsarkitekturer samt erfarenhet av att vara arkitekt i större projekt och av att utvärdera och köpa in nya system.
* Vi söker dig som har goda analysförmåga, ledaregenskaper och hög kapacitet.


 Meriterande kvalifikationer:
   

  

* Kunskap om sakförsäkring.
* Erfarenhet inom försäkring eller finans och kunskaper i lean-agila arbetssätt och SAFe.


 Du kan skapa tydliga och anpassade presentationer för effektiv kommunikation och beslutsfattande. Du kommunicerar bra med både IT-specialister och affärsverksamheten, och du uttrycker dig väl på svenska och engelska, både muntligt och skriftligt. Du arbetar självständigt och har starkt självledarskap.
   

  

**Om oss**
 Om du vill vara med och driva arkitektur inom sakförsäkringsaffären på Länsförsäkringar och vara en del av vårt arkitektteam och i vår grupp med affärsutvecklare, hållbarhetsansvarig, agilt PMO och coacher för lean-agilt arbetssätt, så är du välkommen att söka tjänsten. Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
   

  

**Mer information**
*Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.*
**Sista ansökningsdag: 2024-08-12**
 Observera att svarstiden för denna rekryteringsprocess kan vara längre än vanligt, detta på grund av semestertider. Vi uppskattar ditt tålamod och kommer att återkomma så snart som möjligt

title: License Owner, Stockholm
description:
**Passionate about football (soccer) AND about business? Stranger Soccer is expanding to key cities around the world. We are looking for a License Owner to open and operate the Stranger Soccer business in Stockholm.**
 This is not your traditional management job - it is truly built for someone that wants to own and operate their own business (that happens to make the world's greatest sport accessible to everyone). This role is ideally suited for an adventurous and football-passionate entrepreneur.
   

  

**Sounds Like You?**
 As a next step, please visit www.strangersoccer.com and particularly the section Bring Stranger Soccer to your City to learn more about this dynamic opportunity.
 **If it appears to be a fit, and you wish to learn more, please fill out the form there to officially express your interest.** 
 Be sure to download and explore the Stranger Soccer mobile app as well.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Bring the Stranger Soccer brand and business to life for the assigned city
* Recruit, train, and lead a small central team (2-3 persons) as well as a few freelance Official Hosts (game hosts) to kick off the operation
* Identify and secure prime slots at football venues to run Stranger Soccer games
* Engage in creative sales and marketing digital and hands-onto ensure that customers are introduced to the platform as a convenient and preferred way to play
* Oversee a schedule of games, ensuring customers are delighted with each game they play, and keep coming back for more
* Take advantage of the strong backing and direction of Singapore headquarters, where an operations and technology team is ready to support you.


**You should have**
* A passion for football, and a strong connection to your local football scene
* A business background, ideally in management and customer service
* An entrepreneurial background or spirit
* A commitment to owning, driving, and scaling the Stranger Soccer brand in the assigned market
* A hunger to succeed: financial compensation for this role will be proportionate to hard work, business acumen, and effectiveness.


**About Stranger Soccer**
 With 3.5 billion football enthusiasts in over 200 countries, football is the most popular sport in the world. But why dont more people play it? Stranger Soccer (www.strangersoccer.com) makes playing football as easy as going for a jog or to the gym. Browse dozens of games on its acclaimed Mobile App. Book a slot. Turn up and play.
   

  

 Incorporated in 2017, Stranger Soccer has quickly transformed the sports & recreation scene in Singapore. In a few short years, it has grown to be the #1-way people play football and futsal in the country, amassing tens of thousands of registered users purchasing thousands of slots every week. Whether you call it Fussball, Fútbol, Calcio, or anything else, the world now awaits.
   

  

**Our Mission**
 To make playing football as easy as going for a jog.
   

  

**Our Vision**
 A world in which playing football is as popular and widespread as watching football.
   

  

**Got what it takes?**
**We look forward to meeting you.**

title: Head of Data & Insights
description:
Avalanche Studios Group (ASG) is looking for a Head of Data & Insights to own the data and insights strategy of the entire organization of self-published and externally published games.
   

  

 As the Head of Data & Insights, you will spearhead our efforts to leverage data across all aspects of our gaming experiences. Your primary focus will be on enhancing our data-centric efforts spanning data science, data lake development, and data engineering. Your knowledge will largely contribute towards the structuring and optimization of our data systems in correlation with our gaming experiences. You should also maintain a keen understanding of user insights and market research.
   

  

 You will work closely with cross-functional teams from all areas of the business to identify opportunities to grow and support our player communities. Your expertise will drive strategic decisions, enhance player engagement, and fuel game development with actionable data-driven insights.
   

  

 This is a strategic leadership role requiring strong knowledge of the gaming industry as well as all major methods and tools used to create insights and act upon the results . The successful candidate will have significant experience in a similar leadership role.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
* Leadership and Strategy: Provide visionary leadership for the data and insights team. Develop and execute a comprehensive data strategy that aligns with our company’s goals and enhances our gaming platforms. Also develop and implement a mission and vision for your team.
* Data Science and Analytics: Oversee the design and implementation of analytics models and algorithms to predict trends, user behavior, and game performance.
* Data Infrastructure: Direct the development and maintenance of robust data infrastructure, including a data lake with trusted data, to support large-scale data aggregation and analysis. Work with the Avalanche central tech function to make sure that the tools we use are world class and low on maintenance.
* Market and Player Insights: Oversee a team of experts in market research and user insights efforts to understand market trends, player needs, and satisfaction drivers. Translate insights into actionable recommendations for game development and marketing strategies. Build and cultivate a proactive insights culture through the usage of a brand tracker and regular internally distributed reports.
* User Research: Initiate and expand user research initiatives to better understand player journeys, game interactions and experiences through research methods such as interviews, live usability tests and other studies.
* Collaboration and Integration: Work closely with game development teams, publishing, marketing, and executive leadership to ensure that data insights are integrated into all facets of business decision-making and product development.
* Team Development: Build and mentor a high-performing team of data scientists, engineers and research professionals. Foster a culture of innovation, collaboration, and continuous learning within the team. Hire strong candidates into key roles.
* Foster a Test-Driven Culture: Champion a culture of experimentation and testing within the organization, emphasizing the importance of A/B testing and other empirical methods to guide decisions. Encourage the use of data and testing in new initiatives, feature developments, live service games, prototyping and strategy adjustments.


**Who You Are**
* Exceptional leadership experience at a senior level.
* Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Math, Computer Science or a related field.
* A keen interest in the video game industry and understanding what drives player behavior and motivation.
* Experience with big data technologies and data visualization tools.
* Demonstrated ability in leading or working with market research and user insight projects.
* Excellent English communication skills with the ability to convey complex insights to stakeholders as well as being capable of working effectively with cross-functional teams.
* Strategic decision-making abilities.
* Strong problem-solving and critical-thinking skills.


*Research shows that under-represented groups in the industry (especially women) might not apply for a job if they don't check off every requirement. Here at Avalanche Studios Group we're more about your drive to learn and interest in tackling challenges than what's on your resume. So, don't stress if you don't hit every mark— give it a shot and apply! Diversity of opinion and experience make our teams even better.*
**The Stockholm location**
 Our Stockholm office is situated in Södermalm, the beating heart of the city’s game industry. It’s a physical representation of our games – the lush vegetation of Just Cause and theHunter: Call of the Wild meets corroded metal straight out of Mad Max. It has everything you need to make it your creative base camp.
   

  

**About Us**
 Avalanche Studios Group is a game developer and publisher that defined and evolved open-world games, offering an amazing portfolio of fantastic games across multiple genres, including the Just Cause franchise, Rage 2, theHunter: Call of the Wild, Generation Zero, and Second Extinction as part of its portfolio.
   

  

**Employee promise**
 We provide goals, instead of instructions, and the opportunity to do the best work of your career.
   

  

**Our Values**
 At Avalanche Studios Group, we believe in worlds beyond limits, and we are committed to developing a diverse and inclusive workplace. We are an equal-opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. Everyone at Avalanche Studios Group has a shared responsibility to create an open and inclusive work environment where everyone is treated equally and with respect. Being part of our world is not contingent on where you’re from, your gender, or sexual orientation. It’s all about your passion and creativity.
   

  

**How To Apply**
 We will only consider applications that consist of both a cover letter and a CV. In your cover letter, you should include why you want to work at Avalanche Studios Group. For this role, you need to be able to work from within our Stockholm Studio, alongside the strategic partnerships team.We apply a hybrid work model that enables you to work some days from home and some days from the office.

title: Private Equity – Partner, Head of Private Wealth AND Institutional Relations – In Sweden
description:
Our client is a London-based asset management firm specialising in institutional private equity, venture capital, and direct investments. There focus is on deep-tech sectors, particularly in artificial intelligence, Web3, quantum technologies, and autonomous systems. They are now looking for a Partner, Head of Private Wealth AND Institutional Relations in
 **Sweden.** 




  





  





 As a spin-off from an established family office and the investment team of the largest deep- tech institutional investor in Europe, The Firm brings a wealth of experience to the table.
 



  





  





 The investment team comprises seasoned professionals in deep-tech fund investing, boasting a track record of investing over €3.5 billion in capital, over a span of more than 15 years.
 



  





  





 Complementing the investment team is a distinguished tech team, featuring PhDs and professors from leading UK universities. Specialised in deep tech, including AI and advanced mathematics, they enhance our capability to navigate and thrive in cutting-edge technological landscapes.
 



  





  





**The roles:** 




  





  





***Role 1: Partner, Head of Private Wealth Relations in Sweden***




  





*Location: Sweden - Swedish Market* 




*Remote Working/Hybrid: Yes possible* 




*Start Date: ASAP* 




  





  





**Candidate Requirements:** 




  





  




* **15 years' + working directly with clients in the private wealth sector (Family Offices, UHNWI. HNWI, etc) and a successful track record of capital raise from these clients. Your background and experience stems from working with organisations such as Private Banks, Asset Managers, Multi Family Offices, PE firms, Fund of Funds or Fund or Placement Agent.**



  





  





**Essential Experience:** 
**Head of Private Wealth Management in Sweden** 




  





  




* Proven success in previous client relationship positions held at Private Banks, Asset Managers, Multi Family Offices, PE firms, Fund of Funds or Fund Placement Agencies
* Extensive existing network with private wealth investors (Family Offices, UHNWI. HNWI, etc) with proven track record on capital raised from them.
* Experience in advising private wealth clients on investments or capital allocations.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills with a proven track record of building and maintaining investor relationships.
* A challenging mind with the ability to think creatively / laterally, able to present your ideas to show how we can improve what we do and how we can do it to deliver results.
* Good presentation skills with the ability to convey complex technical information in a clear, simple, and precise way.
* Ability to work well on own initiative and enjoy being part of a small collaborative team.
* Good understanding of investment products and processes in the funds industry; in particular, alternative investments funds.
* A good understanding of DeepTech market dynamics is desirable, but not necessary as training can be provided.
* Must have strong intellectual curiosity, an entrepreneurial spirit.



  





  





**Core Responsibilities:** 




  





 This is a senior role, working directly with and supporting the firm’s founding team.
 



  




* To drive capital raise for the firm’s activities with a focus on private wealth investors.
* Build an account plan for each investor and ensure our value proposition is correctly positioned.
* Build working relationships with key investors and managers in target organisations.
* Know your investors’ commercial situation.
* Prepare and implement documentation to clients/investors in line with internal compliance, legal, and audit requirements.
* Maintain professional knowledge, keep abreast of general market updates, industry developments, and competitor’s activities.



  





  





**Benefits:** 




  





  




* Highly competitive base salary.
* +OTE generous additional annual bonuses on top of basic salary
* Access to meaningful % of GP Carry participation with potential to grow to an 8 figures amount in 2 years, if successful
* Opportunity to become a partner in the firm within short time frame is a strong possibility for the right candidate.



  





  





  





***Role 2: Head of Institutional Relations – in Sweden***




  





*Location: Sweden- Swedish Market* 




*Remote Working/Hybrid: Yes possible* 




*Start Date: ASAP* 




  





  





**Candidate Requirements:** 




  





  




* **Please only apply if you have a Minimum of 15 years' working experience in investor relations, of which a minimum of 5 of those years were working in capital raising capacities for VC Firms, PE firms, Fund of Funds or Fund Placement Agencies.**



  




* **Please note that board member positions, advisory roles, investment in a fund/venture, or freelance positions do not count, and should not be included. We will only consider candidates with full-time employment experience within a VC firm, PE firm, or FOF firm.**



  





  





**Essential Experience:** 
**Head of Institutional Relations in Sweden** 




  




* Proven success in institutional fundraising and investment relationship positions held in previous roles.
* Minimum 15 years' working experience in fundraising, of which minimum of 5 years working experience in a placement agency or a VC/PE Firms, with preference for Fund of Funds.
* Extensive existing network with institutional investors.
* Experience of managing large and institutional investor relationships.



  





  





**Requirements:** 




  




* Excellent written and verbal communication skills with a proven track record of building and maintaining investor relationships.
* A challenging mind with the ability to think creatively / laterally, able to present your ideas to show how we can improve what we do and how we can do it to deliver results.
* Good presentation skills with the ability to convey complex technical information in a clear, simple, and precise way.
* Ability to work well on own initiative and enjoy being part of a small collaborative team.
* Good understanding of investment products and processes in the funds industry; in particular, alternative investments funds.
* A good understanding of AI and Web3 market dynamics is desirable, but not necessary as training can be provided.
* Must have strong intellectual curiosity, an entrepreneurial spirit.



  





  





**Core Responsibilities:** 




  





 This is a senior role, working directly with and supporting the CIO of the fund.
 



  




* To lead and manage the investor relationships and fundraising department with a focus on institutional investors.
* Ensure that any issues, whether contractual or operational, are resolved to both the company's and the client/investor's satisfaction.
* Prepare and implement documentation to clients/investors in line with internal compliance, legal, and audit requirements.
* Build an account plan for each investor and ensure our value proposition is positioned as the market model of the future.
* Know your investors' commercial situation.
* Build working relationships with key investors and managers in target organisations.
* Maintain professional knowledge, keep abreast of general market updates, industry developments, and competitor's activities
* The opportunity to grow within this role and become a partner in the firm within short time frame is a strong possibility for the right candidate.



  





  





**Benefits:** 




  




* Highly competitive base salary.
* +OTE generous additional annual bonuses on top of basic salary
* Access to meaningful % of GP Carry participation with potential to grow to an 8 figures amount in 2 years, if successful
* Opportunity to become a partner in the firm within short time frame is a strong possibility for the right candidate.

title: (Associate) BMC Application Specialist – based in Luxembourg
description:
**This position is based at our Luxembourg headquarters and requires regular office presence.** 
 The EIB offers you the opportunity to live and work in a truly international and multi-cultural environment. We also offer relocation support. The
 **EIB** 
 , the European Union's bank, is seeking to recruit for its Group Corporate Services - Group Digital Office Directorate (GCS-GDO), Business Solutions Department (BSD), Corporate Applications Division (CA), Transversal Solutions Unit (TS) at its headquarters in Luxembourg, an
 **(Associate) BMC Application Specialist\*.**
**This is a full time position at grade 4/5 for which the EIB offers a permanent contract.**
* internal benchmark (Associate) Engineer IT Technology & Infrastructure


***Panel interviews are anticipated for October.***
 Purpose
   

  

 You will look after the design, development and maintenance of the deployed functionalities in the BMC platform, in line with industry best practices and regulations.
   

  

 Operating Network
   

  

 Within the Corporate Applications Division, the primary role of the Transversal Solutions Unit is to identify, implement and maintain technical solutions, which digitalise and optimise some of the business and IT processes of the Bank.
   

  

 Among them, BMC Platform is central due to the complexity of the architecture and the coverage of services reflected in number of users across EIB Group.
   

  

 You will report to the Head of Admin Suite Unit and will have regular contact with colleagues in other Directorates, notably with Enterprise Architecture, IT Security, Integration and other IT teams. You will also cooperate with counterparties in client directorates in the functional areas covered by the Transversal Solutions Unit and have frequent contact with external suppliers.
   

  

 Accountabilities
   

  

* Participate to new and existing initiatives delivering code, configuration and scripts related to; BMC Digital Workplace Advanced, BMC Digital Workplace Catalog, BMC SmartIT, BMC SmartReporting, BMC Dashboards, BMC ITSM) in close collaboration with the relevant internal and external stakeholders
* Take project management responsibilities and contribute to the preparation of documentation and reporting involved for delivering new or enhanced solutions
* Ensure continuous improvement of the application landscape implementing standardization and agile delivery model in line with the IT enterprise architecture guidelines and recommendations, best practises and operational and audit needs
* Manage and provide 2nd level user support for end-users
* Liaise with the test manager to prepare and execute test scenarios, analyse test results on database impacts, errors or bugs, and usability
* Coordinate the IT application consultants to the highest standards, project discipline and accountability
* Participate in special initiatives that can go beyond the strict boundaries of own domain
* Remain up-to-date with the last trends in the IT market


**Qualifications**
* University degree (minimum an equivalent to a Bachelor) preferably in Engineering, Information Technology or a related field.
* Minimum 3 years of relevant professional experience, including experience involving requirements analysis, software design, development, 2nd level support, implementation and maintenance of BMC/Helix Digital Workplace Advanced, BMC Digital Workplace Catalog, BMC SmartIT, BMC SmartReporting, BMC Dashboards and BMC ITSM
* Experience working with multicultural and international teams
* Good technical background in Object Oriented Design Programming (C#, Java), scripting languages (Unix shell, Python, PL-SQL) and DBMS Systems (Oracle and/or MSSQL and/or MySQL)
* Good knowledge of cloud principles
* Able to work with various counterparts and disciplines (HR, financial, operations etc), understand and translate their requirements into software solutions in line with their needs
* Excellent knowledge of English and/or French (\*\*), with a good command of the other.


 Competencies
   

  

*Find out more about EIB core competencies* 
 here
   

  

*(\*\*) Unless stated explicitly as a required qualification, a good command of French is not a pre-requisite for hire. As both English and French are however official working languages of the EIB, proficiency in both languages is a pre-requisite for your future career development. Any language clause in your contract must be fulfilled in order for you to be eligible for a promotion (either via the annual appraisal cycle or via an internal selection process). Proficiency is understood to mean the attainment of level 5 of the Inter Institutional language courses, corresponding to B1.2 of the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFRL). The Bank offers appropriate training support.*
 We hire and value talent with unique characteristics, creating a work environment where they can be themselves. We believe that Diversity, Equity and Inclusion makes us a performing and innovative organisation. We encourage all suitably qualified and eligible candidates to apply regardless of their gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation, disability or neurodiversity.
   

  

 To find out more about our eligibility criteria click here
   

  

 We strongly invite applicants with a disability, neurodivergent profile or chronic condition to request reasonable accommodations at any stage during the recruitment process. Please contact the EIB Recruitment team Jobs@eib.org who will ensure that your request is handled.
   

  

 By applying for this position, you acknowledge the importance of maintaining the security and integrity of the Information of the EIB Group. In case of selection for the position you agree to comply with all measures (policies, controls, document classification and management) implemented by the EIB Group to prevent unauthorised disclosure of any information or any damage to the EIB Group reputation.
   

  

 Deadline for applications:
 **20th September 2024**

title: Ekonom till Tobiasregistret
description:
Är du utbildad ekonom och har en bred erfarenhet från kvalificerat redovisningsarbete? Har du arbetslivserfarenheter från mindre företag eller större med koncernanknytning? Vill du vara delaktig i ett bolag som arbetar med ett register för blodstamcellsgivare? Då kan detta vara tjänsten för dig!
   

  

 Tobiasregistret AB förvaltar det svenska registret för givare av blodstamceller. Tobiasregistret AB har varit självständigt bolag sedan januari 2021 men registret har existerat sedan 1992. Verksamheten har sin bas i Stockholm men är av nationellt intresse då all sökning av frivilliga givare av blodstamceller till svenska och utländska patienter initieras och sker via Tobiasregistret. Bolaget verkar internationellt genom samarbete med stamcellsregister i hela världen.
   

  

 Om tjänsten
   

  

 Vi söker nu en erfaren redovisningsekonom/ekonomiansvarig med bred erfarenhet. Som ansvarig kommer du ha en viktig roll i att stötta Tobiasregistrets VD och vara en del i bolagsledningen inom redovisningsområdet.
   

  

 Rollen inkluderar (men är inte begränsad till):
   

  

* Löpande bokföring
* Kund- och leverantörsreskontraansvar
* Avstämning av koncerninterna mellanhavanden
* Ansvara för månads-, delårs- och årsbokslut
* Upprättande av årsredovisning
* Moms-, skatte- och inkomstdeklarationer
* Koncernrapportering inkl. analyser av utfall
* Avstämning balanskonton och analys av resultatkonton
* Framtagande av nyckeltal
* Ekonomirapportering till styrelse
* Ta fram budget, årsprognos och likviditetsprognos
* Systemförvaltare för kodplanen
* Ansvarig vid revision
* Ta fram ekonomiunderlag i verksamhetsplan
* Delta i ekonomi- och systemrelaterade projekt
* Fungera som stöd och rådgivare i redovisningsfrågor
* Anläggningsredovisning


 Vem är du?
   

  

 Du är ansvarstagande, lösningsorienterad och van vid att arbeta självständigt. Du är driven och har förmåga att ta initiativ och initiera aktiviteter som ger resultat och levereras i tid. Du har en mycket god kommunikativ förmåga och är serviceinriktad. I ditt arbete agerar du på ett lugnt och professionellt sätt och har en god prioriteringsförmåga. Det är viktigt att du är bra på att bygga relationer och på att samarbeta eftersom du kommer ha mycket kontakter både inom verksamheten och utanför regionen. Du bör även ha ett genuint intresse för Tobiasregistrets verksamhet.
   

  

 Kvalifikationer
   

  

 Krav:
   

  

* Högskoleexamen som civilekonom eller motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet
* Minst 5 års dokumenterad erfarenhet av brett och kvalificerat redovisningsarbete
* Mycket goda redovisningskunskaper och hög IT-mognad
* God svenska och engelska i tal och skrift
* Mycket goda kunskaper i Excel samt övriga MS-Office verktyg
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med kund- och leverantörsreskontra


 Meriterande:
   

  

* Erfarenhet från hälsa- och sjukvård
* Erfarenhet från processarbete
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i Raindance
* Erfarenhet av rapportering i Stödet och eller andra specifika system inom Region Stockholm


 Vårt erbjudande
   

  

 I denna roll ingår varierande arbetsuppgifter i en just nu föränderlig miljö där vi förbättrar våra rutiner och system för att hantera omvärldens krav på våra tjänster.
   

  

 Vi erbjuder en dynamisk och utvecklande arbetsmiljö med engagerade kollegor med goda utvecklingsmöjligheter och kompetensutveckling. Vi har kollektivavtal och med det följer kollektivavtalade försäkringar, tjänstepension och möjlighet till löneväxling. För att du ska kunna ta ansvar för din hälsa erbjuder vi friskvårdstimme och friskvårdsbidrag samt subventionerad sjukvård i form av kostnadsfri öppensjukvård. Flexibel arbetstid och möjlighet till att arbeta hemifrån har vi för att underlätta för dig att få ihop vardagen. Läs mer om förmånerna i vårt kollektivavtal här.
   

  

 Anställningen är tillsvidare på heltid med tillträde snarast enligt överenskommelse. Tjänsten är placerad centralt i Stockholm på Sabbatsbergs sjukhus.
   

  

 Ansökan
   

  

 Låter det här som något för dig ser vi gärna att du söker så snart som möjligt. För en komplett ansökan räcker det med att bifoga ditt CV. När du ansöker kommer du att få besvara ett antal frågor, dessa ersätter personligt brev.
   

  

 Har du frågor är du välkommen att kontakta Tobiasregistrets VD Nicole Silverstolpe på nicole.silverstolpe@regionstockholm.se.
   

  

 Sista ansökningsdag är 8 september.
   

  

 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 Tobiasregistret är det svenska nationella registret för potentiella givare av blodbildande stamceller. Syftet med verksamheten är att rädda liv genom att ge svårt sjuka patienter i behov av blodstamceller möjlighet att hitta en obesläktad givare. Registret består av frivilliga donatorer, samt den nationella biobanken för navelsträngsblod.
   

  

 Varje år görs flera tusen sökningar efter passande givare i Tobiasregistret. Motsvarande register finns på många andra håll i världen, med vilka man samarbetar. Sammanlagt är mer än 36 miljoner personer registrerade som potentiella stamcellsdonatorer. Tobiasregistret utför ett nationellt uppdrag, och ägs av Region Stockholm. Läs mer här
   

  

 Att söka jobb i Region Stockholm Vi eftersträvar jämställdhet och jämlikhet på vår arbetsplats och ser gärna sökande med olika bakgrund och förutsättningar. Vi tar endast emot ansökningar via detta system. Ansök genom att klicka på knappen ”Ansök”. Ansökningar per brev eller e-post beaktas inte. Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt säljare av ytterligare jobbannonser. Vårt rekryteringssystem kan inte hantera anonyma ansökningar eller sökande med skyddade personuppgifter. Om du har skyddade personuppgifter ber vi dig att kontakta den kontaktpersonen som finns angiven i annonsen. Din ansökan kommer då att hanteras utanför rekryteringssystemet. Du bör även vara försiktig med vilken information du lämnar i din ansökan och endast ta med information som är relevant för den aktuella befattningen. Region Stockholm ansvarar för hälso- och sjukvård, kollektivtrafik, regional utveckling och bidrar till kulturlivet. Varje dag, dygnet runt. I landets snabbaste växande region. Tillsammans skapar vi Europas attraktivaste storstadsregion. Läs mer om hur det är att jobba hos oss i Region Stockholm
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100 | Ort: Stockholm | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2024/5047 | Kontakt: Nicole Silverstolpe 070-7373135, | Facklig företrädare: Anne-Lie Vestlund , Vision 070-7375715, Mona Ternelius , SACO 070-0038708, | Publicerat: 2024-09-02 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2024-09-08

title: Norsktalande Application support till Advania
description:
Här får du som junior möjlighet att utvecklas inom IT på lång sikt i ett familjärt bolag som satsar på sina medarbetare. Är du redo att växa inom yrkeslivet och bygga på dina IT-kunskaper? Välkommen med din ansökan eftersom Advania söker sina nästa medarbetare så snart som möjligt.
 



  





**Information om tjänsten** 




  





 Advania är en helhetsleverantör av kundunika IT-lösningar och finns på 13 platser i Sverige. Hos Advania får du arbeta i en inkluderande miljö med kollegor som är experter inom området och som tillsammans har roligt på jobbet.
 



 Tjänsten är en direktrekrytering, vilket innebär att rekryteringsprocessen sker genom Professionals Nord, och du anställs direkt hos Advania. Alla frågor kring tjänsten går till info@pn.se
 



  





**Du erbjuds** 




  




* En väl planerad introduktion och möjlighet att skugga duktiga kollegor som ser fram emot att dela med sig av sin kunskap
* Förmåner som exempelvis ett generöst friskvårdsbidrag
* Ett fint kontor i Liljeholmen och möjlighet att arbeta på distans
* God utvecklingspotential beroende på vad du brinner för, exempelvis om du vill fördjupa dig i det tekniska på en mer avancerad nivå eller utforska andra områden inom bolaget
* Att vara en del av ett familjärt bolag där välbefinnande är det viktigaste.



  





**Arbetsuppgifter** 




  





 Som Junior Applikationstekniker är du en del av en grupp om tre kollegor som arbetar inom Legal-grupperingen. Ni är specialiserade på lösningar och tjänster för advokater och jurister inom Advokatsamfundet. Du hjälper kunder primärt via telefonsamtal och e-post samt arbetar i Servicenow. Ärendena varierar, och det kan exempelvis handla om:
 



  




* Support av kunders slutanvändare och ge ett bra bemötande, både remote och på plats hos kund.
* Verksamhetsnära applikationssupport
* Behörighetsfrågor i Active Directory samt support i Windows- och Mac-miljö
* VPN-frågor
* Löpande följa upp och slutföra användares ärenden
* Identifiera och rapportera återkommande problem inom Advanias supportleverans



  





**Vi söker dig som** 




  




* Har ett starkt intresse för IT
* Kunskap inom Officepaketet
* Du kan kommunicera på norska, svenska och engelska.



 Det är meriterande om du har körkort och erfarenhet av att arbeta med service över telefon, exempelvis som kundtjänstmedarbetare.
 



  





 På kontoret råder en avslappnad stämning, och för att lyckas i rollen är det viktigt att du är en lagspelare som älskar att lära dig nya saker. Du agerar professionellt i all kontakt med kunderna och är mycket serviceinriktad.
 



  





 START: Enligt överenskommelse
 



 OMFATTNING: Rekrytering
 



 STAD: Stockholm, Liljeholmen
 



 URVAL: Sker löpande
 



 KONTAKT: Kathinka Evers
 



  





 Belastningsregister kommer att stämmas av för samtliga kandidater i slutfas i rekryteringsprocessen.

title: Sales Development Representative
description:
**ABOUT THE COMPANY:**
 Join Addendum Group, a software development and IT outsourcing company with more than 20 years of hands-on experience by serving Financial services, Telecom, and smart Government industries in the US and Europe. The company specializes in business process analysis & optimization, system integration, maintenance, optimization, custom development, mobile app development and maintenance.
   

  

 Addendum Group philosophy is to develop long-term relationships with Customers, Partners, Employees, and Suppliers. The long-term partnership ensures three main things: exceptional industry knowledge, superior team performance and proven track record.
   

  

**ABOUT THE ROLE:**
 Were looking for a results-driven sales representative to actively seek out and engage customer prospects that are looking for dedicated teams to create winning digital products. You will provide complete and appropriate solutions for customers in order to boost top-line revenue growth, customer acquisition levels and profitability.
   

  

**WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING:**
* Identify leads via cold-calling, networking, events and/or other sources and develop relationships with C level executives within targeted markets and sectors
* Manage customer relationships throughout the sales cycle and closing process, where you will be the single point of contact (POC)
* Develop and manage a pipeline of qualified opportunities
* Ensure that our customers' orders are filled with the talent they need
* Forecast business and manage the GAP between forecast and target
* Hit sales targets in both revenue and profitability
* Maintain a high level of visibility and communication with the customer to help ensure we're providing exceptional customer service
* Establish, develop and maintain positive business and customer relationships


**WHAT WE EXPECT:**
* Minimum of 5 years experience in selling IT services/technology consulting services
* 4+ years of progressive experience in sales, consulting, and/or the resources industry, where you have developed relevant expertise through consulting engagements focused on finance, energy, or utilities.
* Recent experience selling dedicated teams, staff augmentation services
* Proven track record in achieving annual sales of at least $ 2MM
* Entrepreneurial mindset with an ability to recognize opportunities for improvement
* Demonstrated ability to close deals ranging in size from $250K to $5M+
* Proficiency managing all sales opportunities, pipeline activity and all account activity in CRM
* Ability to create and deliver presentations tailored to the audience needs
* Ability to travel as required


**WHAT WE OFFER:**
**Salary** 
 : The compensation package is market-competitive and will be negotiated with the successful candidate.
   

  

**Position type** 
 : Contract based.
   

  

 At Addendum we believe in personalized benefits packages that cater to your unique passions. Tell us what drives you, and we'll craft a package accordingly.
   

  

 So, get your dancing shoes on and come join the fun!
   

  

*At ADDENDUM, we wholeheartedly reject all forms of discrimination, including but not limited to age, disability, sex, sexual orientation, pregnancy and maternity, race or ethnicity, religion or belief, gender identity, marriage, civil partnership, or any other protected category. We are committed to fostering a culture of equality and inclusion, where every individual has the opportunity to thrive.*

title: Night Receptionist - On-Call
description:
Radisson Hotel Group is one of the world's largest hotel groups with ten distinctive hotel brands, and more than 1,160 hotels in operation and under development in 95+ countries. The Group’s overarching brand promise is Every Moment Matters with a signature Yes I Can! service ethos.
   

  

 People are at the core of our business success and future. Our people are true Moment Makers and together we bring the culture, spirit, environment and opportunities that empower you to be your best, every day, everywhere, every time. Together, we make Every Moment Matter.
   

  

 We are now looking for an
 **On-call Night Receptionist** 
 to join our dynamic team here at
 **Radisson Blu Airport Terminal** 
 !
   

  

 We focus on you as a person, your skills, talents, and passion – not only on your resume. Because mindset is what it’s all about. And you can grow the rest with us. That's a promise!
   

  

**The On-call Night Receptionist Role**
 Our front office team is the heart of the house, providing a warm welcome and happy smile, and where we strive to deliver an experience that is beyond expectation - creating memorable moments for our guests.
   

  

  

* Our On-call Night Receptionists love the hustle and bustle of life! It’s not just about check-in and check-out. It’s about everything in-between
* You will be our guests’ superhero ensuring all aspects of the guest journey and experience are anticipated and delivered to the highest level
* You will exude patience, empathy and have the personality to host the show
* You are a true night owl who enjoys working while others count sheep
* As an integral part of the team, you will work proactively to ensure guest satisfaction and the smooth running of the front office department


 As On-call Night Receptionist, you will join a team that is passionate about delivering incredible service where we believe that anything is possible, whilst having fun in all that we do!
   

  

**Qualities We Are Looking For In Our On-call Night Receptionist**
* Flexibility and a positive, Yes I Can! Attitude
* An eye for detail
* Is a creative problem-solver
* Passionate about creating extraordinary service
* Ability to work as part of a team to ensure guest satisfaction
* Strong verbal communication skills
* Likes having fun at work
* Experience in a similar position is beneficial but not essential


**What We Offer Our On-call Night Receptionist**
 We aim to be as good a place to work as we are to stay. That is why we offer a competitive compensation and benefits package, which includes:
   

  

  

* Becoming a part of the #3 Best Employer in the Travel & Leisure industry globally, ranked by Forbes in 2023
* Special rates for our team members, and friends and families while travelling and staying in our hotels
* We take our “We grow talent, talent grows us” culture belief to heart. With us you will benefit from a wide range of development offers supporting your learning & growth right from your onboarding. This includes an individual development plan and unlimited access to more than +20K learning modules & programs through Radisson Academy
* Participate and live Responsible Business every day together with our team members in the hotel and in the local communities where we work on creating shared value, better futures and a better planet for all
* A workplace covered by collective agreement
* An international workplace with colleagues and guests from all over the world


 The Radisson Hotel Group portfolio includes Radisson Collection, Radisson Blu, Radisson, Radisson RED, Radisson Individuals, art'otel, Park Plaza, Park Inn by Radisson, Country Inn & Suites by Radisson, and prizeotel brought together under one commercial umbrella brand Radisson Hotels.
   

  

 Become part of the world of Moment Makers, we are looking forward to getting to know you!
   

  

 The Radisson Blu Airport Terminal Hotel is located within easy walking distance of all the Stockholm-Arlanda Airport (ARN) terminals. The on-site On My Way Brasserie & Bar provides a daily Breakfast Buffet featuring Scandinavian and international morning favorites. For lunch and dinner there are a variety of delicious à la carte items, from traditional Swedish favorites to international classics, all with a touch of French cuisine.
   

  

 Each of the 260 soundproof rooms and suites at the Radisson Blu Airport Terminal Hotel offer stylish and modern décor and guests enjoy free access to the fitness center, plus a business center and children’s services. The hotel also features 36 well-equipped meeting rooms, with the largest accommodating up to 80 delegates.
   

  

**Skills**
 Yes I Can! attitude
   

  

 Service-minded

**The On-call Receptionist Role**
 Our front office team is the heart of the house, providing a warm welcome and happy smile, and where we strive to deliver an experience that is beyond expectation - creating memorable moments for our guests.
   

  

  

* Our On-call Receptionists love the hustle and bustle of life! It’s not just about check-in and check-out. It’s about everything in-between
* You will be our guests’ superhero ensuring all aspects of the guest journey and experience are delivered to the highest level
* You will exude patience, empathy and have the personality to host the show
* As an integral part of the team, you will work proactively to ensure guest satisfaction and the smooth running of the front office department


 As On-call Receptionist, you will join a team that is passionate about delivering incredible service where we believe that anything is possible, whilst having fun in all that we do!
   

  

**Qualities We Are Looking For In Our On-call Receptionist**
* Flexibility and a positive, Yes I Can! Attitude
* An eye for detail
* Is a creative problem-solver
* Passionate about creating extraordinary service
* Ability to work as part of a team to ensure guest satisfaction
* Strong verbal communication skills
* Likes having fun at work
* Experience in a similar position is beneficial but not essential


**What We Offer Our On-call Receptionist**
 We aim to be as good a place to work as we are to stay. That is why we offer a competitive compensation and benefits package, which includes:
   

  

  

* Becoming a part of the #3 Best Employer in the Travel & Leisure industry globally, ranked by Forbes in 2023
* Special rates for our team members, and friends and families while travelling and staying in our hotels
* We take our “We grow talent, talent grows us” culture belief to heart. With us you will benefit from a wide range of development offers supporting your learning & growth right from your onboarding. This includes an individual development plan and unlimited access to more than +20K learning modules & programs through Radisson Academy
* Participate and live Responsible Business every day together with our team members in the hotel and in the local communities where we work on creating shared value, better futures and a better planet for all
* A workplace covered by collective agreement
* An international workplace with colleagues and guests from all over the world


 The Radisson Hotel Group portfolio includes Radisson Collection, Radisson Blu, Radisson, Radisson RED, Radisson Individuals, art'otel, Park Plaza, Park Inn by Radisson, Country Inn & Suites by Radisson, and prizeotel brought together under one commercial umbrella brand Radisson Hotels.
   

  

 Become part of the world of Moment Makers, we are looking forward to getting to know you!
   

  

 The Radisson Blu Airport Terminal Hotel is located within easy walking distance of all the Stockholm-Arlanda Airport (ARN) terminals. The on-site On My Way Brasserie & Bar provides a daily Breakfast Buffet featuring Scandinavian and international morning favorites. For lunch and dinner there are a variety of delicious à la carte items, from traditional Swedish favorites to international classics, all with a touch of French cuisine.
   

  

 Each of the 260 soundproof rooms and suites at the Radisson Blu Airport Terminal Hotel offer stylish and modern décor and guests enjoy free access to the fitness center, plus a business center and children’s services. The hotel also features 36 well-equipped meeting rooms, with the largest accommodating up to 80 delegates.
   

  

**Skills**
 Yes I Can! attitude
   

  

 Positive
   

  

 Service-Minded

title: DevOps Engineer (R-16371)
description:
**Why We Work at Dun & Bradstreet**
 Dun & Bradstreet unlocks the power of data through analytics, creating a better tomorrow. Each day, we are finding new ways to strengthen our award-winning culture and accelerate creativity, innovation and growth. Our 6,500+ global team members are passionate about what we do. We are dedicated to helping clients turn uncertainty into confidence, risk into opportunity and potential into prosperity. Bold and diverse thinkers are always welcome. Come join us! Learn more at dnb.com/careers .
   

  

 The candidate will be working in a small team focusing on devops.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Build, Improve and support CI/CD pipelines with a goal to maximize velocity, accuracy of deployments and faster deployment time
* Improve DevOps process to mitigate production, performance, and operational problems and resolve issues as they occur
* Collaborate closely with other members of the Devops, architects and development teams
* Ensure configuration and compliance with analysis tools (for instance SonarQube)
* Assist the Engineering team with OpenTelemetry based observability initiatives focused on self-service monitoring (Kibana/Grafana) and troubleshooting
* Work with the security engineering team to ensure that security guardrails(Snyk) are implemented as early as possible in pipelines and resolve any infrastructure vulnerabilities.
* Work collaboratively with software engineering to define infrastructure and deployment requirements


**Requirements**
* DevOps Experience
* AWS
* Linux OS solid knowledge
* Bash and Python scripting
* Kubernetes
* Docker
* GitHub
* English speaking
* Should be ok with context-switching


**Nice To Have**
* SonarQube
* Bamboo
* Scrum/Kanban
* Experience with database or cloud migration
* General knowledge of programming languages to be able to figure things out when needed
* Building and Running JVM based languages
* Building and running NodeJS based languages
* Location in Stockholm is a plus but not necessary


**Why Join Us?**
**Benefits**
 Does this role sound like a great opportunity but you’re not sure about making a move? We are really proud of our company and culture and think we have some great things to offer. Some of our benefits in Sweden include:
   

  

* Two paid volunteer days to contribute to causes in your community
* A paid day every year to use for your health and wellness
* Instead of half days before public holidays, you will have 4 additional full days a year for you to use to celebrate what is meaningful to you
* Annual wellness/sport benefit
* Collective agreement, pension, insurance and parental pay allowance
* Access to free services providing support and counselling
* Flexible working arrangements and hybrid work arrangement for most roles


***Whilst some roles do have certain requirements which are essential, we try to focus on hiring based on potential rather than CV as much as possible. If you are unsure you fully meet the requirements, we would still love to hear from you!***
 All Dun & Bradstreet job postings can be found at https://www.dnb.com/about-us/careers-and-people/joblistings.html and https://jobs.lever.co/dnb . Official communication from Dun & Bradstreet will come from an email address ending in @dnb.com.
